channel.title: Homes on Haipeng Yu
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Haipeng Yu

item.description: About me I am a Ph.D. student in the Morota Lab in the Department of Animal and Poultry Sciences at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. My research interest is focused on applying statistical methods to study quantitative genetics.

item.title: Softwares
item.description: R package Connectedness: An R package to 1) measure the connectedness across management units using genomic or pedigree data and 2) assess the connectedness between training and testing sets in genomic prediction. Github Source & Documentation

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Graduate Teaching Assistant at Virginia Tech ALS 3104: Animal Breeding and Genetics Guest Lecture at Univeristy of Nebraska-Lincoln ASCI 944/STAT 844 Quantitative Methods for Genomics of Complex Traits Slide & R Graduate Teaching Assistant at North Dakota State University ANSC 357: Animal Genetics AGRI 189: Skills for Academic Success
